ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk4:0.5_0: The second training rule on well-covered
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk4:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk4:1.2_0: At that time the monks from the group of six were sitting in inhabited areas with their bodies uncovered. ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk4:1.3.1_0: “‘I will sit well-covered in inhabited areas,’ this is how you should train.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk4:1.4_0: He should sit well-covered in inhabited areas;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk4:1.5_0: If a monk, out of disrespect, sits in an inhabited area with his body uncovered, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk4:1.6.1_0: there is no offense for him.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk4:1.8_0: To give rise to the robe.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk4:1.11_0: if he has entered his dwelling;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk4:1.14_0: if he is the first offender.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk4:1.15_0: The fourth training rule is finished.
